channel.title: Project Jarāʾid
channel.description: A Chronology of Nineteenth-Century Periodicals in Arabic (1800-1900)

item.title: website went online
item.description: Hurrah, the website finally went online!

item.title: website updated: added rss
item.description: added an rss feed generated from the TEI XML's revisionDesc to the update information in toc2

item.title: website updated: added internal links
item.description: We added anchors to the indexes and provided links to these entries in the indexes in the main chronology in the form of tiny arrows behind any person, organization, ot location

item.title: website updated: improved sorting
item.description: We improved sorting to include all the IJMES transliterations of Arabic words into the Latin alphabet with the diacritics following the "normal" letters; i.e. ḥ and ḫ follow immediately after h. In addition, we now ignore the Arabic definite article "Al-" preceding most newspaper titles.

item.title: website updated: reduced file size
item.description: To the benefit of all those dependent on slow internet connections, we reduced the size of the main html files by some 15 per cent through removing unneccessary namespace declarations

item.title: website updated: new mapping
item.description: After some study of Google's map JavaScript Api and the KML markup language, as well as some tinkering with Api calls to geonames.org, we are now able to automatically harvest the geo-location data for the all placeNames in the TEI source and thus plot them onto any geo-tagging aware map

item.title: website updated: new design and functions
item.description: Sorting of the main table can now be triggered between chronologic and alphabetical. Links between the various indexes and the main table have been implemented allowing for round trips from individual titles to publishers to another title to a location etc.
